components.component:
org.richfaces.inputNumberSlider org.richfaces.inputNumberSlider
org.richfaces.component.html.HtmlInputNumberSlider
org.richfaces.component.UIInputNumberSlider
org.richfaces.component.html.HtmlInputNumberSliderComponentTest org.ajax4jsf.tests.AbstractAjax4JsfTestCase
A component that lets selecting a number from a numeric region. It is a horizontal aligned scroll-like control with its own input field (optional) present. The keyboard input in a field is possible (optional. Also it is possible to see the current value in the tool tip above a dragged handle control.
org.richfaces.InputNumberSliderRenderer inputNumberSlider.jspx
inputNumberSlider
org.richfaces.taglib.InputNumberSliderTag
org.ajax4jsf.webapp.taglib.HtmlComponentTagBase
orientation java.lang.String Attribute can have the values "vertical" and "horizontal" to define in which direction the slider should be moveable. ""
showArrows boolean False value for this attribute makes increase/decrease arrows invisible. Default value is "false". false
delay int Delay in pressed increase/decrease arrows in miliseconds. Default value is "200". 200
value java.lang.String Value to set as a result of working with a slider control ""
minValue java.lang.String Attribute to set the "start" value. Default value is "0". "0"
maxValue java.lang.String Attribute to set an "end" value. Default value is "100" "100"
step java.lang.String Parameter that determines a step between the nearest values while using a handle. Default value is "1". "1"
width java.lang.String The width of a slider control. Default value is "200px", for orientation="vertical" value is "200px" "200px"
height java.lang.String The height of a slider control. Default value is "20px", for orientation="vertical" value is "20px" "20px"
enableManualInput boolean If set to "false" this attribute makes the text field "read-only", so the value can be changed only from a handle. Default value is "true". true
showInput boolean False value for this attribute makes text a field invisible. Default value is "true". true
showBoundaryValues boolean If the min/max values are shown on the right/left borders of a control. Default value is "true".
true
showToolTip boolean
If "true"the current value is shown in the tooltip when a handle control is in a "dragged" state. Default value is "true".
true
inputStyle java.lang.String Style attribute for text field ""
inputClass java.lang.String Style Class attribute for a text field ""
inputSize int Similar to the "Size" attribute of h:inputText. Default value is "3". 3
disabled boolean Makes a text field and controls non-active. Default value is "false".
false
onerror java.lang.String HTML: script expression; a non-number value or a number value that is out of the range is input
""
clientErrorMessage java.lang.String an error message to use in client side validation events
onslide java.lang.String Event occur on slide ""
onchange java.lang.String a JavaScript handler that is called when handle change position.
""
style java.lang.String Styles for main div element of the slider control
""
styleClass java.lang.String Name of a CSS class ""
barStyle java.lang.String Style for a slider control line
""
barClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for the bar element ""
handleClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for a control handle element ""
handleSelectedClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for a selected control handle element ""
tipStyle java.lang.String A style for the tool tip element
""
tipClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for the tool tip element ""
increaseStyle java.lang.String A style for the increase arrow element
""
increaseClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for increase arrow element ""
increaseSelectedClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for a selected control increase arrow element ""
decreaseStyle java.lang.String A style for the decrease arrow element
""
decreaseClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for the decrease arrow element ""
decreaseSelectedClass java.lang.String A name of CSS class for a selected control decrease arrow element ""
inputPosition java.lang.String If "right", the InputText Box would be rendered on the right side of the ruler. If "top", the InputText Box would be rendered on the top of the ruler. If "bottom", the InputText Box would be rendered on the bottom of the ruler. "right"
&ui_component_attributes; &html_input_attributes; &html_input_events; &ui_input_attributes; &html_events;
oninputclick java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a pointer button is clicked
oninputdblclick java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a pointer button is double-clicked
oninputkeydown java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a key is pressed down
oninputkeypress java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a key is pressed and released
oninputkeyup java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a key is released
oninputmousedown java.lang.String HTML: script expression; a pointer button is pressed down
oninputmousemove java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a pointer is moved within
oninputmouseout java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a pointer is moved away
oninputmouseover java.lang.String HTML: a script expression; a pointer is moved onto
oninputmouseup java.lang.String HTML: script expression; a pointer button is released
onkeydown java.lang.String
onkeypress java.lang.String
onkeyup java.lang.String
size int
align java.lang.String
alt java.lang.String For user agents that cannot display images, forms, or applets, this attribute specifies an alternate text. Language of an alternate text is specified by the lang attribute
localValueSet boolean
valid boolean
label java.lang.String A localized user presentable name for this component.
